intro: Swida oblonga, commonly known as the narrowleaf holly, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features small, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter in color on the underside. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. Swida oblonga is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and versatile plant for garden use.
